before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"1hq80","text":"User Supplied Equipment and Consumables: Before starting an experiment, check the \"User Supplied Equipment and Consumables\" section and confirm that your lab has all of the supplies that are not provided by the kit. Avoid substituting custom materials for those that are provided in the kit. Each item has been deliberately chosen to attain optimal results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f3rb8","text":"Avoiding RNase Contamination: Standard precautions should be taken to avoid introducing RNases into samples or reagents throughout the workflow. Always wear proper laboratory gloves and use aseptic technique. RNases are not inactivated by ethanol or isopropanol, but can be inactivated by specific products such as RNaseZap RNase Decontamination Solution (Thermo Fisher Scientific). These can be sprayed on benchtops and used to clean pipette. It is recommended to use pre-sterilized, filter pipette tips to reduce RNase contamination from pipettes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dcup6","text":"Centrifuges: Use a swinging bucket centrifuge for all high speed spin steps in this protocol. Use of a fixed-angle centrifuge will lead to substantial cell loss. Although the recommended centrifugation speeds are appropriate for most sample types, they can be adjusted to improve retention.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfvks","text":"Centrifuge Tubes: Ensure that the tubes will be used are polypropylene and not polystyrene. Polystyrene tubes will lead to substantial cell loss.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjv4g","text":"Sample Handling: It is critical that cells are thoroughly resuspended after centrifugation. Resuspend cells by slowly (to prevent mechanical damage) and repeatedly pipetting up and down until no clumps are visible. Wide bore pipette tips are not recommended as they make it difficult to adequately resuspend cell pellets. Due to cell adherence to tubes, it is recommended to carefully pipette along the bottom and sides of the centrifuge tubes to minimize cell loss.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u49b","text":"Sample Loading Table: The \"WT Mega - Sample Loading Table V1.2.0\" (Excel spreadsheet) should be completed before starting the experimental workflow. If not working properly, ensure that the Macros are enabled in the Sample Loading Table. Be sure to only edit the colored cells on the table to avoid disturbing the necessary formatting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55ooa","text":"Maximizing Cell Retention During Pooling Steps: During the barcoding steps, some cells may stick to the side of the wells in the 96-well plates. To increase cell retention, it is important to pipette up and down several times in each well before removing and pooling cells. Note that additional pipetting may lead to increased bubbles while pooling. While bubbles will not affect results, we advise using caution when pipetting to prevent excess bubble formation and maintain experimental ease. We recommend the following procedure when pooling:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c6bci","text":"Set the multichannel P200 to 10 µL less than the volume in each well. The volumes for Barcoding Rounds 1, 2, and 3 should be 30 µL, 50 µL, and 70 µL, respectively. This will avoid bubbles while pipetting up and down.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"520qo","text":"Insert tips into the bottom of the wells. Pipette up and down 3x in the middle of the well, then pipette up and down 3x on the front side of the well, followed by 3x on the back side of the well, before proceeding with pooling cells.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8543u","text":"Pool any remaining liquid left in the wells (should be ~10 µL).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mpb7","text":"Sealing Plates in Original Container: There are multiple steps requiring the removal and application of seals to 96-well plates. In either motion, ensure that the plate is in its original container for best support. Failure to do so may result in plate slippage and loss, or swapping, of liquid between wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5t87c","text":"Cell Strainers: A 40 µm cell strainer will be used in multiple steps. To maximize cell retention, press the pipette tip directly against the stainer. Ensure that ample pressure is applied to hold contact between the tip and the strainer to force liquid through in ~1 second. For cells larger than 40 µm, the 40 µm strainer should be replaced throughout the protocol with the appropriate size mesh (70 µm or 100 µm).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5th0d","text":"Lysis Buffer Precipitate: Ensure that there is no precipitate when using the 2x Lysis Buffer. Warming the 2x Lysis Buffer at 37C for 5 minutes should resolubilize solution. If precipitate remains, warm 2x Lysis buffer at 37C for another 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":26}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ao9ri","text":"Sequencing Libraries: Multiple sequencing libraries can be prepared from the same experiment. At the end of barcoding (Section 1), the recovered cells can be split across different sublibraries. The number of cells to be sequenced is determined when cells are divided into sublibraries at the lysis step. Thus, not all of the cells prepared in these steps must be sequenced together.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fiqpt","text":"This protocol describes the original Parse Biosciences Evercode WT Mega v2 protocol for single-nucleus or single-cell RNA-seq of 1,000,000 nominal nuclei or cells. Unlike other scRNA-seq methods that physically separate individual cells into different compartments to label transcripts with cell-specific barcodes, Evercode WT Mega uses the cells (or nuclei) themselves as “containers” in which intracellular transcripts are labeled using combinatorial indexing. In practice, cells are split into different wells, a well-specific barcode is appended to intracellular transcripts, and cells are then pooled back together. Repeating this process several times ensures a high likelihood that each cell travels through a unique combination of wells. Consequently, the transcriptome of each individual cell is labeled with a unique combination of well-specific barcodes. Unlike previous methods that scale linearly with the number of available compartments and barcodes, this method scales exponentially with the number of barcoding rounds, enabling a massive increase in the number of cells that can be sequenced, while minimizing doublets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8730a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4g23","text":"The products of this protocol are up to 16 subpools of varying size, where each molecule has a cell/nucleus barcode and UMI, ready for Illumina short-read sequencing. The cell/nucleus barcode is unique within each subpool, so the subpol index acts as the fourth barcode to uniquely barcode all the cells/nuclei within an experiment. Please see the attachment for the original Parse Biosciences protocol. The main deviations from the original protocol are 1. loading 15 ul rather than 14 ul in the Round 1 barcoding plate and 2. saving all \"leftover\" barcoded nuclei or cells at -80C for potential repeats.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":466,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":484,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":528,"length":54}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hdi2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hc4q","text":"The first part of the protocol, Section 1, describes barcoding cells or nuclei. Briefly, fixed cells/nuclei are thawed and added to the Round 1 reverse transcription barcoding plate at 37,500 cells/nuclei per well across 96 wells. Individual samples from each tissue are distributed in the sample barcoding plate with at least 1 well per sample. Within the fixed cells/nuclei, RNA is reverse transcribed using oligodT and random hexamer primers and the first barcode is annealed. After RT, cells/nuclei are pooled and distributed in 96 wells of the Round 2 ligation barcoding plate for in situ barcode ligation. After Round 2, cells/nuclei are pooled and redistributed into 96 wells of the Round 3 ligation barcoding plate for barcode 3 and Illumina adapter ligation. Finally, cells/nuclei are counted using a hemocytometer, distributed into up to 16 subpools, and lysed. The second part, Section 2, describes template switching and amplification of the full-length cDNA. Importantly, full-length cDNA from Section 2 is the input for cDNA Exome Capture. For non-exome captured Illumina libraries, proceed to Section 3: Preparing Libraries for Sequencing. Section 3 describes Illumina library preparation with 100 ng of full-length cDNA per subpool. Subpool cDNA is fragmented and Illumina P5/P7 adapters are ligated during the final amplification. Importantly, if using single indices (WX100) please follow Appendix D: Single Indexing. If using dual indices (WX200) follow main protocol. Libraries with 5% PhiX spike-in are sequenced on an Illumina sequencer as paired-end, single-index (140/86/6/0) or dual-index reads (130/86/8/8).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":972,"length":183},{"style":"bold","offset":1209,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":1348,"length":140}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eqdh6","text":"Prepare for the first round of barcoding with the following checklist:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frgnt","text":"Each sample should have been counted after nuclei fixation and recorded on the spreadsheet in order to calculate volumes to normalize concentrations to 2,500 cells/nuclei per ul. Adjust target volumes as necessary depending on the volume needed in the final plate(s).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8idf7","text":"At least a day ahead of the experiment, distribute dilution buffer in a new sample normalization plate one well at a time (NOT the actual barcoding plate) and store at -20C.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g1h6","text":"On the day of the experiment, take out sample normalization plate and thaw at room temperature. {"blocks":[{"key":"cmu5u","text":"To thaw, place the Round 1 Plate into a thermocycler and set the following protocol below. The heated lid will force any liquid on the plastic plate seal back down into the well. Proceed to the next step while the thermocycler is {"blocks":[{"key":"i1rk","text":"Gently remove the Round 1 Plate from the thermocycler and place into the original green plastic plate holder. Carefully peel the plate seal while applying downward pressure to keep the plates from moving (to minimize cross-contamination of wells).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":183}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"11oo2","text":"Add diluted samples to wells in the Round 1 Plate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfcfo","text":"Note: To prevent sample loss, mix cells as indicated below. Additionally, this step requires a new box of 20 µl tips.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":117}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3o6cr","text":"Follow the Sample Loading Table during this step to determine which samples to add to each well. Using a multichannel pipette, add 15 µl nuclei/cells from the sample normalization plate to each of the 96 wells in the Round 1 Plate. Immediately after dispensing cells, mix gently by pipetting up and down exactly 3x. When pipetting the same sample into many wells, the same sample should be periodically mixed by gentle pipetting to avoid cells settling. Do not vortex your cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":131,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":217,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o3sc","text":"Critical! Different tips must be used when pipetting cells into the 96-well plate. Never place a tip that has entered one of the 96 wells into a different well. {"blocks":[{"key":"fsdeq","text":"Pool all wells from the Round 1 Plate into a single 15-mL centrifuge tube on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qqbp","text":"Note: Proper mixing is required to prevent substantial cell loss during pooling. See \"Maximizing Cell Retention During Pooling Steps\" in Notes Before Starting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":159}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76b84","text":"The pooling process can be simplified (see figure below). With the multichannel pipette set to 30 µL, pool rows B-D into the wells in Row A, then pool rows F-H into the wells in Row E. To maximize cell retention while pooling, pipette up and down 3x in the middle of the well, 3x on the front side of the well, and 3x on the back side of the well before transferring the volume of the rows to Row A or Row E. Recover residual liquid across rows B-D and F-H using the multichannel pipette set to 10 µL. Next, pipette the total volume in Row A up and down 3x, then transfer the total volume of each well in Row A into the same 15 mL centrifuge tube with a single channel P200 pipette set to 200 µL. Do the same with Row E. Do not be concerned if there are a few µL of residual volume in the wells after pooling. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5jgq4","text":"Note: Bubbles may form while pooling. They will not affect the quality of the experiment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":89}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vsi","text":"Critical! Do NOT pool all eight rows into a single row or the liquid may overflow. Keep the Round 1 Plate and the 15 mL falcon tube with pooled cells on ice during the pooling step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9qqcu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7jpu","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":195,"id":418774,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2023-08-16 at 7.50.07 PM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n28255dw.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n28y55dw.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n28z55dw.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n28x55dw.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hs2b","text":"Add 19.2 µL of Spin Additive to the 15 mL tube with pooled cells. Gently invert the tube once to mix. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":15,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"addpo","text":"Critical! Do NOT discard the Spin Additive as it will be needed in another step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":29,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"340cl","text":"Centrifuge the pooled cells in a swinging bucket centrifuge cooled to 4C for 10 minutes at 200 x g.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":70,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":77,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":91,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":97,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amf7u","text":"Critical! Move to the next step as soon as the centrifuge finishes and handle the tube gently to avoid dislodging the cell pellet. Waiting too long to aspirate supernatant increases the risk of dislodging the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2vuf0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3b1ur","text":"Using a P1000 pipette for the first 3 mL, then a P200 pipette for remaining volume, aspirate supernatant such that about ~40 µL of liquid remains above the pellet. Do not disturb the pellet. Depending on the number of starting cells and cell types, the pellet may not be visible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7kocg","text":"Note: To prevent substantial cell loss during resuspension, see \"Sample Handling\" in Notes Before Starting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":107}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4vg0a","text":"Gently resuspend cells with 1 mL of Resuspension Buffer. Once cells are fully resuspended, add an additional 1 mL  of Resuspension Buffer to make a total volume of 2 mL. Keep this solution on ice and proceed to Ligation Barcoding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":20},{"style":"bold","offset":98,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":118,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"difbk","text":"Gather the following items and handle as indicated below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dejh3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sgtm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8r7r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["Item","Location","Quantity","Format"," After taking out"],"colWidths":[100,100,100,100,"163"],"data":[["2x Lysis Buffer","4C Reagents (4C)","1","1.5 mL tube","Keep warm at 37C until use."],["Lysis Enzyme","Barcoding Reagents (-20C)","1","1.5 mL tube","Place directly on ice."],["Dilution Buffer","Barcoding Reagents (-20C)","2","2 mL tube","Thaw, then place on ice."]],"guid":"F93D34C7DE724D60A742F7E949D482CF","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"9tr9i","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["2x Lysis Buffer","4C Reagents (4C)","1","1.5 mL tube","Keep warm at 37C until use."],["Lysis Enzyme","Barcoding Reagents (-20C)","1","1.5 mL tube","Place directly on ice."],["Dilution Buffer","Barcoding Reagents (-20C)","2","2 mL tube","Thaw, then place on ice."]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83ajo","text":"Add 70 µL of Spin Additive to your cells in a 15 mL centrifuge tube. Gently invert the tube once to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4rj40","text":"Use a swinging bucket centrifuge to spin down the cells for 10 minutes at 200 x g at 4C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":60,"length":11},{"style":"bold","offset":74,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":85,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":80,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cmgnm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9utqn","text":"Using a P1000 pipette for the first 6 mL, then a P200 pipette for the remaining volume, aspirate supernatant such that ~40 µL of liquid remains above the pellet. Do not disturb the pellet. Depending on the number of starting cells and cell types, the pellet may not be visible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blb9l","text":"Note: To prevent substantial cell loss during resuspension, see \"Sample Handling\" in Notes Before Starting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":107}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dj1j6","text":"Gently resuspend cells with 1 mL of Pre-Lyse Wash Buffer. When resuspending the pellet, pipette slowly to prevent mechanical damage to cells. Once cells are fully resuspended, add an additional 3 mL of Pre-Lyse Wash Buffer for a total volume of 4 mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":22},{"style":"bold","offset":183,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":202,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"19vkq","text":"Use a swinging bucket centrifuge to spin down for 10 minutes at 200 x g at 4C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":64,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":2},{"style":"italic","offset":70,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1n1fg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93uu3","text":"Using a P1000 for the first 3 mL, then a P200 pipette for the remaining volume, aspirate supernatant such that ~40 µL of liquid remains above the pellet (see image on the right for estimate of 40 µL). Do not disturb the pellet. Depending on the number of starting cells and cell types, the pellet may not be visible.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2b74p","text":"Note: To prevent substantial cell loss during resuspension, see \"Sample Handling\" in Notes Before Starting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":107}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1avtv","text":"Using a P200 pipette, gently resuspend the pellet with an additional 200 µL of Dilution Buffer, bringing the final volume to ~240 µL. When resuspending the pellet, pipette slowly to prevent mechanical damage to cells. Keep tubes on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":69,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":79,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5gd2d","text":"Critical! Do NOT discard Dilution Buffer as it will be needed in another step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d3se1","text":"Using a P200 pipette set to 200 µL, gently pipette up and down the 5x and immediately use 5 µL of the mixed cells to count using a hemocytometer. Keep the 15 mL tube on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":90,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"20ooa","text":"Note: When using a hemocytometer, dilute 5 µL of the mixed cell solution into 5 µL of Trypan Blue or DAPI. Mix well and load onto the hemocytometer. Some level of debris is normal at this step. Alternatively, cells can be counted via flow cytometry, but using a hemocytometer is strongly recommended. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":301},{"style":"bold","offset":41,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":78,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8a7si","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qq2g","text":"Choosing Sublibrary SIzes: In the following step, cells will be aliquoted into different sublibraries that will be prepared for sequencing. At the end of the library prep, each sublibrary will have its own sublibrary index, making it possible to sequence each sublibrary with different numbers of reads. It is also possible to add different numbers of cells to each sublibrary. In practice it can be useful to have at least one sublibrary with very few cells (200-500) that can be sequenced deeply (\u003e50,000 reads per cells) with a limited number of overall reads. This sublibrary then provides a good estimate of gene and transcript detection per cell that would be expected if the other sublibraries were also sequenced deeply. The maximum number of cells that can eventually be sequenced will be the sum of the number of cells across all sublibraries.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":853}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lpt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dgkdn","text":"We slightly overload 15 subpools with 67,000 cells/nuclei and one subpool with 13,000 cells/nuclei for exome capture and long read sequencing. Any extra barcoded cells/nuclei are distributed in additional 67,000 aliquots and kept at -80C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":238}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a25bq","text":"Determine sublibrary size(s) and dilutions. Up to 16 sublibraries, of varying sizes, can be made. Use the \"Sublibrary Generation Table\" (Appendix A) to determine the volume of cells and Dilution Buffer to add to each sublibrary (dependent on desired sublibrary size and the concentration of cells measured in the previous step). Give each sublibrary a unique label. Make sure to record which sublibrary sizes correspond to what labels. Label both the top and side of the PCR tube with those labels. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":44},{"style":"bold","offset":186,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84po2","text":"Critical! Do NOT overload a sublibrary. 62,500 cells/sublibrary is the maximum. Overloading a sublibrary lysate with too many cells will result in increased doublets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1r47d","text":"Using a P200 pipette set to 200 µL, gently pipette up and down 5x. Aliquot the determined volume of cells (from the previous step) to each correctly labelled sublibrary PCR tube and add Dilution Buffer to bring to total volume to 25 µL. Between each aliquot, gently pipette mix the cells to avoid settling. Store sublibraries on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":186,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5o7ci","text":"Make a Lysis Master Mix. Ensure there is no precipitate present in the 2x Lysis Buffer. Add 440 µL of 2x Lysis Buffer to 88 µL of Lysis Enzyme in a 1.5 mL tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":71,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":92,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":102,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":121,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":129,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36p3o","text":"Critical! Do NOT place Lysis Master Mix on ice, as a precipitate will form.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"esfq3","text":"Add Lysis Master Mix to sublibraries. Add 30 µL of Lysis Master Mix to each tube, bringing the total volume to 55 µL. Keep sublibraries at room temperature.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":38},{"style":"bold","offset":42,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ed72","text":"Remove the desired sublibrary lysates from the -80C freezer and incubate at 37C for 5 minutes, ensuring that no precipitate is present before proceeding. If precipitate is still present, incubate at 37C for 5 more minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":76,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":84,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":199,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15eg2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"fpojo","text":"Briefly centrifuge sublibrary lysates (~ 2 sec).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"94gr0","text":"Lightly centrifuge the Lysis Neutralizer, mix gently with a pipette, and add 2.5 µL to each sublibrary lysate. Place tubes into a 96-well plastic plate holder (press tubes securely into holder) and put plate holder lid back on. Vortex the plastic holder on 10 (or equivalent max setting) for 1 minute. Remove tubes from plate holder. Briefly centrifuge (~2 sec), and incubate at room temperature for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":23,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":77,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":292,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":400,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjpri","text":"Add Binder Beads to sublibrary lysates. First mix the Binder Beads suspended in Bind Buffer A by pipetting up and down. Vortex plastic holder on 10 (or equivalent max setting) for 1 minute. Protocol","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["1","3 min","95C"],["2","20 sec","98C"],["3","*45 sec","*65C"],["4","3 min, then go to step 2, repeat 4 times (5 cycles {"blocks":[{"key":"5vdce","text":"Remove tubes from the thermocycler. Sublibraries can be stored at this point at 4C overnight. If you wish to continue, proceed directly to Section 2.5: Post-Amplification SPRI Clean Up.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"edn12","text":"[STOPPING POINT]","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"akp2h","text":"2.4 Post-Amplification SPRI Clean Up","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6n43t","text":"Place the sublibrary tubes against a magnetic rack (for 0.2 mL tubes) on the high position and wait for all the beads to bind to the magnet (~2 min: liquid should be clear).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7tlni","text":"Critical! Do NOT discard the supernatant at this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ffjbm","text":"Transfer 90 µL of the clear supernatant into new 200 µL PCR tubes. Discard the original tubes with the magnetic beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"duer","text":"Remove SPRI beads (Ampure XP or KAPA Pure Beads) from the 4C fridge and aliquot the following amount into a 1.5 mL tube (this accounts for 10% extra volume):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1uajn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2a3pj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1qc6k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","","","","","","","","",""],"colWidths":[100,"53","53","53","53","53","53","53","53","53"],"data":[["# Sublibraries","1","2","3","4","5","6","7","8","16"],["SPRI Beads Needed","79","158","238","317","396","475","554","634","1,266"]],"guid":"F6CD24644CAB40078C552DC1439EC794","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"31dfh","text":"Volume to Add by Number of Sublibrary Lysates (µL)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["# Sublibraries","1","2","3","4","5","6","7","8","16"],["SPRI Beads Needed","79","158","238","317","396","475","554","634","1,266"]],"rowHeights":[23,23]}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1c2mc","text":"Prepare a fresh 85% ethanol solution (400 µL) for each sublibrary.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3a4s3","text":"Add 72 µL of SPRI beads to each sublibrary (90 µL) for a total volume of 162 µL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4uurk","text":"Close the tops of the tubes securely, vortex (~5 sec), then centrifuge briefly (~2 sec).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c24qs","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3ov7f","text":"Place the tubes against a magnetic rack on the high position and wait for all the beads to bind to the magnet (~2 min: liquid should be clear).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8m3t0","text":"With SPRI beads still against a magnetic rack, aspirate and discard the clear supernatant with a pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"foodd","text":"Without resuspending beads, add 180 µL of 85% ethanol and wait for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":67,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4qmgk","text":"Using a pipette, aspirate and discard the ethanol from each tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"div3t","text":"Without resuspending beads, add another 180 µL of 85% ethanol and wait for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ar27b","text":"Using a pipette, aspirate and discard the ethanol from each tube (it may be necessary to remove the final few drops with a P20 pipette). With the tube still on the rack, air dry the beads (~2 min).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s5j7","text":"Critical! Do NOT over-dry the beads. Over-drying of beads can lead to substantial losses in yield. \"Cracking\" of the beads is a sign of over-drying.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"65r1","text":"Remove the tubes from the magnetic rack and resuspend beads from each tube in 25 µL of molecular biology grade water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":77,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73stk","text":"Incubate the tubes at 37C for 10 minutes to maximize elution of amplified cDNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":22,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":30,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6u4es","text":"Place the tubes against a magnetic rack on the low position (with magnets closest to the bottom) and wait for all the beads to bind to the magnet (~2 min: liquid should be clear).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":47,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52esv","text":"Transfer 25 µL of the eluted DNA into new PCR tubes with a P200 pipette. Discard the tubes with the SPRI beads. The amplified cDNA is now ready to be quantified.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"38u2q","text":"Note: Label the new PCR tubes as cDNA to avoid confusion in subsequent steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":77}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7dq3m","text":"Measure the concentration of the cDNA using the Qubit dsDNA HS protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"taq3","text":"Note: Be sure to record sample concentrations as they will be needed for further downstream steps (Section 3.5: Sublibrary Index PCR).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":134}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8pahb","text":"Run 1 µL of the cDNA on a Bioanalyzer or TapeStation. Use the concentration obtained from the Qubit to determine the appropriate dilution necessary (check manufacturer specifications, 1:10 dilution is generally appropriate). See Figure 1 for the expected cDNA size distribution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8k2d6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dstfu","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"d74rt","text":"Note: The traces above are representative of typical Bioanalyzer and TapeStation cDNA traces. The shape and prominence of the trace is dependent on cell type, sublibrary size, and amount of DNA loaded into the Bioanalzyer or TapeStation. Sublibraries with minor deviations can still produce high quality data.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":309}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"height":443,"id":418778,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":[{\"key\":\"actb2\",\"text\":\"Fig. 1: Expected cDNA Size Distribution after cDNA Amplification. (A) Example trace of cDNA run on a Bioanalyzer. (B) Example trace of cDNA run on a TapeStation (it is normal for libraries to be shifted to the left on a TapeStation relative to a Bioanalyzer).\",\"type\":\"unstyled\",\"depth\":0,\"inlineStyleRanges\":[{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":0,\"length\":6},{\"style\":\"bold\",\"offset\":8,\"length\":56}],\"entityRanges\":[],\"data\":{}}],\"entityMap\":{}}","mime":"image/png","original_name":"Screen Shot 2023-10-30 at 4.26.27 PM.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n28655dw.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n28455dw.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n28555dw.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/n28355dw.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"25bi","text":"Sublibraries can be stored at this point at 4C for up to 2 days or at -20C for up to 3 months. If you wish to continue, proceed directly to Section 3: Preparing Libraries for Sequencing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45ntp","text":"[STOPPING POINT].","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52nk2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"en26j","text":"Setup","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52mlc","text":"- Prepare ~1.2 mL 85% ethanol per sublibrary lysate (e.g. 2.4 mL for 2 sublibraries).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6g16d","text":"- Fill an ice bucket.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2fe","text":"- Take out the Parse Biosciences magnetic rack for 0.2 mL PCR tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"andqf","text":"- Ensure you have at least 176 µL of SPRI beads (Ampure XP or KAPA Pure Beads) per sublibrary. These will be used throughout Section 3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62soj","text":"- Obtain recorded cDNA concentrations from step 2.5.18.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jbss","text":"Gather the following items and handle as indicated below:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4de31","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6s0cc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lf86","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"69qsg","text":"3.1 Fragmentation, End Repair, and A-Tailing","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"174d","text":"Vortex amplified cDNA briefly (2-3 sec). Be sure to keep caps closed on tubes. Briefly centrifuge tubes (~2 sec).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vcst","text":"For each sublibrary to be sequenced, aliquot 100 ng of cDNA into a PCR strip tube, then add molecular biology grade water to bring the total volume to 35 µL. Ensure that any concentrations obtained by the Qubit, not the Bioanalyzer, are recorded for further downstream steps (Section 3.5: Sublibrary Index PCR) and store any remaining cDNA at -20C to be used for future experiments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":3},{"style":"bold","offset":49,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2e0c","text":"Note: Keep these tubes on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4b7ki","text":"Initiate the thermocycling program such that the machine is pre-cooled to 4C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"58es","text":"Vortex the Fragmentation Buffer followed by a brief centrifugation (~2 sec) and confirm it is fully thawed (no precipitate). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":11,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8n0h6","text":"Make the Fragmentation Mix, ensuring the Fragmentation Buffer and Fragmentation\nEnzyme blend are well mixed before using (mix ~10x with a pipette after adding Fragmentation Enzyme):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":41,"length":21},{"style":"bold","offset":66,"length":20},{"style":"bold","offset":159,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5826","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dca5v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","","","","","","","","",""],"colWidths":["117","55","55","55","55","55","55","55","55","55"],"data":[["# Sublibraries","1","2","3","4","5","6","7","8","16"],["Fragmentation Buffer","5.5","11","16.5","22","27.5","33","38.5","44","88"],["Fragmentation Enzyme","11","22","33","44","55","66","77","88","176"],["Total","16.5","33","49.5","66","82.5","99","115.5","132","264"]],"guid":"099D9BAEE3534ACB910AB5EBAC9C18FD","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"52poi","text":"Volume to Add by Number of Sublibrary Lysates (µL)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["# Sublibraries","1","2","3","4","5","6","7","8","16"],["Fragmentation Buffer","5.5","11","16.5","22","27.5","33","38.5","44","88"],["Fragmentation Enzyme","11","22","33","44","55","66","77","88","176"],["Total","16.5","33","49.5","66","82.5","99","115.5","132","264"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjica","text":"Add 15 µL of Fragmentation Mix to each sublibrary (should still be in cold block), bringing the total volume to 50 µL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":13,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"use","text":"Mix sublibraries with a P200 multichannel pipette set to 40 µL Briefly centrifuge sublibraries (~2 sec) and place back on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e8mla","text":"Place tubes in the chilled thermocycler and press \"skip\" or similar option to allow the machine to proceed to the next step. Confirm that the thermocycler has elevated to 32C and has proceeded to the rest of the protocol before leaving the machine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6tbvn","text":"Proceed directly to Section 3.2 after the thermocycling protocol finishes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"caufq","text":"3.2 Post-Fragmentation Double-Sided SPRI Selection","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"foqia","text":"Remove your SPRI beads (Ampure XP or KAPA Pure Beads) from the 4C fridge and aliquot the following amount into a 1.5 mL tube (this accounts for 10% extra volume):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"puop","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7134p","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"btccq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["","","","","","","","","",""],"colWidths":[100,"56","56","56","56","56","56","56","56","56"],"data":[["# Sublibraries","1","2","3","4","5","6","7","8","16"],["SPRI Beads Needed","44","88","132","176","220","264","308","352","704"]],"guid":"1B99C0E23F2145A3A026E078771EFB61","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"88rec","text":"Volume to Add by Number of Sublibrary Lysates (µL)","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["# Sublibraries","1","2","3","4","5","6","7","8","16"],["SPRI Beads Needed","44","88","132","176","220","264","308","352","704"]],"rowHeights":[23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cel7t","text":"Add 30 µL of SPRI beads to the 50 µL of fragmented sublibraries and vortex briefly (2-3 sec) followed by a brief centrifugation (~2 sec).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"t84","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsrmi","text":"Place the sublibrary tubes against a magnetic rack (for 0.2 mL tubes) on the high position (with magnet closest to the top) and wait for all the beads to bind to the magnet (~2 min: liquid should be clear).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14aml","text":"Critical! Do NOT discard the supernatant at this step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5i0i6","text":"With SPRI beads still against the magnetic rack, transfer 75 µL of the clear supernatant into new 200 µL PCR tubes. Discard the tubes with the SPRI beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":58,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6iioe","text":"Add 10 µL of SPRI beads to the 75 µL of supernatant and vortex briefly (2-3 sec) followed by a brief centrifugation (~2 sec).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2n4p5","text":"Incubate at room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9usg","text":"Place the tubes against a magnetic rack on the high position and wait for all the beads to bind to the magnet (~2 min: liquid should be clear).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"nb4n","text":"Critical! This may take longer than other SPRI bead binding due to the low volume of beads. Ensure that all of the beads have bound before proceeding.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"23f3l","text":"With SPRI beads still against the magnetic rack, aspirate and discard the clear supernatant with a pipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6g22","text":"Without resuspending beads, add 180 µL of 85% ethanol and wait for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":67,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"d4pg3","text":"Using a pipette, aspirate and discard the ethanol from each tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fg0hl","text":"Without resuspending beads, add another 180 µL of 85% ethanol and wait for 1 minute.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":6},{"style":"bold","offset":75,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"52m64","text":"Using a pipette, aspirate and discard all of the ethanol from each tube (it may be necessary to remove the final few drops with a P20 pipette). Air dry the beads (only ~30 seconds due to the small amount of beads).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"67vgh","text":"Critical!
